business.headline: PhysicsWallah IPO: Is it a good bet or should investors skip the listing?PhysicsWallah IPO will remain open for bidding from November 11 to November 13, 2025, with the allotment to be finalised on November 14, 2025.

Equity inflows fall 19% in October despite market rise: AMFIAmong equity categories, most still managed to bring in money, but with mixed momentum. Flexicap funds remained the most sought-after option, collecting Rs 8,928 crore, a solid 27% rise month-on-month.

Warren Buffett signs off: Key takeaways from his final letter to shareholdersThe 95-year-old investor, who has led Berkshire for nearly six decades, announced he will no longer write the company's annual reports or address shareholders at the annual meeting.

Rs 80,000 crore lying unclaimed: Why families fail to access loved ones' savingsFamilies in India are losing track of their own inheritance. With Rs 80,000 crore unclaimed, financial advisers warn that the problem is not wealth creation, but the absence of clear records, nominations and open discussions at home.

Gold at Rs 1.25 lakh, Silver extends gains: Why are prices rising again?Gold prices surged to Rs 1.24 lakh and silver neared Rs 1.55 lakh amid easing U.S. shutdown worries and Fed rate-cut hopes. Should investors buy now or wait for dips?

Bajaj Finance share price crashes 8%: What's behind today's slide?Shares of Bajaj Finance crashed nearly 8% today after solid earnings were overshadowed by a trimmed growth outlook and rising asset stress.

Want better SIP returns? Follow the 10-7-10 mantra, says expertSIP investors often look for the magic formula to grow wealth faster. According to an expert, the 10-7-10 mantra may be the closest thing to one — a simple, disciplined approach that can potentially boost long-term returns.

Government updates pension rules: Parents must file this document for 75% benefitParents receiving family pension from the government must now file this key document every year to keep the 75% benefit. The revision is part of a new effort to reduce errors and incorrect payouts.

Pine Labs IPO closes today: Is it worth betting on for listing gains?The Rs 3,899.91 crore IPO is a book-built issue, consisting of a fresh issue of 9.41 crore shares worth Rs 2,080 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 8.23 crore shares worth Rs 1,819.91 crore.

Mutual fund SIPs vs direct stocks: Where should young professionals bet?For young professionals, the lure of direct stocks, instant control, multi-bagger dreams, and social-media bravado is understandable. Yet four decades of global and Indian evidence reveal a sobering pattern: discipline and diversification, not adrenaline and instinct, drive enduring wealth creation.

Tata Motors CV arm to list on November 12: What investors should knowTata Motors' decade-long restructuring reaches its final stage as its commercial vehicles arm lists on November 12. What this means for investors, share allotments, and how trading will begin?

Bajaj Finance share price falls 7% after Q2 results. Should you buy the dip?Bajaj Finance shares plunged nearly 7% after Q2 results showed solid profit growth but weaker guidance and rising asset stress. With valuations still rich, is this a buying opportunity?
Sensex, Nifty flat despite positive global sentiment, Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 242.13 points to 83,293.22, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.35 points to 25,502.00 as of 9:32 am.

Groww IPO listing: Strong debut or muted opening on cards? Check what GMP saysThe parent company of Groww, Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd, saw massive investor interest during the subscription window. Groww allotment was finalised on November 10.

Not every IPO is a jackpot: How to know if an IPO is really worth your moneyMany retail investors still go by hype, brand names, and subscription figures rather than understanding whether the issue is actually worth investing in.

PhysicsWallah IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP indicatePhysicsWallah's Rs 3,480 crore IPO consists of a fresh issue of 28.44 crore shares worth Rs 3,100 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.49 crore shares worth Rs 380 crore.

Think missing an EMI is harmless? The impact can last yearsMost borrowers don't plan to miss an EMI, yet life can get in the way. But what feels like a small slip today can turn into a long-term hurdle when you need credit the most.

It's not EMIs, it's FOMO: The real reason Indians can't save, says expertIt's not monthly EMIs draining Indian wallets, it's the fear of missing out. From vacations to gadgets and impulse buys, FOMO is quietly overtaking financial discipline, says an expert, making saving feel optional rather than essential.

Sensex, Nifty end higher despite profit booking; Infosys leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 319.07 points to close at 83,535.35, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 82.05 points to settle at 25,574.35. Most sectoral indices also finished in the green, led by information technology, finance and metals.

Should property be a part of your long-term investment portfolio?With prices rising and rental yields improving, more Indians are turning to property as a long-term wealth investment. But should real estate really be part of your investment portfolio? Read on to find out.

entertainment.headline: Anushka Sharma's Chakda Xpress deserves its release: Actor Dibyendu Bhattacharya In an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, actor Dibyendu Bhattacharya shared his disappointment over 'Chakda Express' being shelved. On his 50th birthday today, the actor even reflected on his childhood memories of celebrating the special occasion with family.

Why Guillermo del Toro's Frankenstein is the adaptation every classic deserves Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' is a masterful adaptation that brings alive the true spirit of Mary Shelley's novel, focusing on the Creature's humanity rather than horror. It beautifully explores themes of loneliness, rejection, and the complex bond between creator and creation.

SS Rajamouli and son Karthikeya cast votes in Jubilee Hills by-election. Video SS Rajamouli and his son SS Karthikeya cast their votes in the Jubilee Hills by-election which took place today, November 11. A video of the two is now going viral on social media.

Naseeruddin Shah does a U-turn on Farhan Akhtar remark, says it was exaggerated Naseeruddin Shah clarified his old remarks about Farhan Akhtar's performance in 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', saying his words were exaggerated by the media. The actor responded after Farhan called his past comments "distasteful."

Kyunki siblings Shagun Sharma, Aman Gandhi dating: Here's what we know Actor Shagun Sharma has confirmed her relationship with Aman Gandhi, who plays her brother in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Bahu Thi 2'. During a recent interview, she clarified that they began dating prior to joining the show.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Dhruvanth spits fire on housemates, Rashika-Suraj hit back Housemates were asked to pick the most venomous contestant, leading Dhruvanth, Ashwini, and Risha to face a fiery green chilli punishment several times.

Allu Arjun reacts to Delhi Red Fort blast, calls it a tragic incident Telugu actor Allu Arjun expressed his grief over the Delhi Red Fort blast, calling it a tragic incident and offering prayers for the victims' families.

Ram Gopal Varma reveals the Bruce Lee connection behind his cult film Shiva As the cult classic 'Shiva' gears up for a 4K Dolby Atmos re-release, director Ram Gopal Varma revealed that his inspiration for the film came from Bruce Lee's 'Return of the Dragon', which he reimagined within the setting of a college campus.

Abhishek Bajaj responds to ex-wife's claims, Tanya Mittal controversy Abhishek Bajaj was evicted from Bigg Boss 19 after not being saved by his friend Pranit More. He addresses his ex-wife's claims and clarifies the nature of Tanya Mittal's behaviour on the show.

Bigg Boss Telugu 9 Day 64: Bharani surprises housemates, Gaurav under fire After a quiet weekend, Monday's nomination episode brought strategy, emotion, and surprise to the 'Bigg Boss Telugu 9' house.

Japanese film icon Tatsuya Nakadai, star of Ran and Harakiri, dies at 92 Japanese cinema legend Tatsuya Nakadai, known for his unforgettable roles in 'Ran', 'Harakiri', and 'The Human Condition' trilogy, has died at 92. Over a six-decade career, the acclaimed actor became a global symbol of Japanese artistry, earning the country's highest cultural honour in 2015.

Fans can't stop praising SRK's humility in viral Dubai restaurant video A recent video of Shah Rukh Khan at a Dubai restaurant has gone viral for all the right reasons. The actor was seen greeting the chef with an 'adab' and interacting warmly with the staff.

Sobhita Dhulipala showers praise on Bad Girl, says 'I teared up and felt seen' Sobhita Dhulipala has publicly commended the Tamil film 'Bad Girl' after its recent OTT release, drawing attention to its bold themes and emotional resonance, and recommending it especially to young women.

Did Amar Kaushik, Vicky quit alcohol, non-veg for Mahavatar? Director responds Director Amar Kaushik has dismissed speculation regarding him and Vicky Kaushal adopting dietary restrictions for their upcoming film, ' Mahavatar', clarifying the project's current status and background.

Jeetendra is fine: Son Tusshar after actor falls at Zarine Khan's prayer meet Veteran actor Jeetendra experienced a minor mishap during the prayer meeting for Zarine Khan in Mumbai, quickly recovering without injury. Family and friends from the film industry attended the gathering to pay their respects.

Lucky Ali on leaving Bollywood, says he felt lost after father Mehmood's death Singer Lucky Ali revealed that he distanced himself from Bollywood not because of its "toxicity" but because he was simply "fed up" and felt disconnected after his father Mehmood's death.

Anumol denies spending Rs 16 lakh on PR campaign to win Bigg Boss Malayalam 7 Anumol, who secured victory in the seventh season of Bigg Boss Malayalam, has publicly denied allegations that she spent Rs 16 lakh on professional PR assistance to win the title. In a recent interview following her win, she clarified the extent and cost of her PR support.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan sets trade abuzz: Film nears Rs 400 crore in pre-release deals With two months to go before its scheduled release, Thalapathy Vijay's final film 'Jana Nayagan' has broken records in pre-release business, drawing significant attention from industry insiders and fans alike.

Nora Fatehi calls Shreya Ghoshal walking autotune on American podcast Nora Fatehi has urged those new to Bollywood music to listen to Shreya Ghoshal's songs. The actor also called the singer a 'walking autotune' on a recent podcast.

general news.headline: Suicide attack near Islamabad court leaves 12 dead, over 20 injuredPakistan blast: The explosion at the heart of the Pakistan capital took place inside a parked vehicle at the Islamabad court complex.

Asim Munir's military coup in Pakistan, without the militaryThough Pakistan has seen coups and military dictators, the coup being staged by army chief Asim Munir is unprecedented. Through the 27th Constitutional Amendment, Munir is getting sweeping powers. The "constitutional coup" would dismantle Pakistan's remaining democratic safeguards and permanently alter its civil-military balance.
Dharmendra responding to treatment and is recovering: Hema MaliniVeteran actor Dharmendra is responding to treatment and is recovering, according to his family.

Dr Umar panicked after Faridabad arrests, acted in haste: Sources on Delhi blastPreliminary intelligence reports claimed the car was rigged with explosives before being driven into the crowded area. The car blew up around 6:52 pm, triggering a fire that engulfed nearby vehicles, killing 9 people.

Video: The moment Red Fort car blast was captured on YouTuber's cameraA high-intensity explosion shook the national capital on Monday evening when a slow-moving Hyundai i20 car exploded at a traffic signal near the Red Fort during peak hours. The powerful blast killed at least nine people and left dozens injured, gutting several vehicles and sparking widespread panic in the crowded area. A video, captured on the camera of a YouTuber, showed people running for their lives as the deafening blast reverberated meters away, with many screaming, "Run! Run!" amid the chaos.

Supreme Court's 'message' day after Delhi blast, denies bail to terror accusedThe bench noted that the accused was a member of a WhatsApp group that carried a flag identical to the Islamic State flag, rejecting the defence's argument that only Islamic literature had been seized from him.

Mom, Dad and Kriti: Tattoos help identify businessman killed in Delhi blastAmar Kataria, a 34-year-old pharma businessman based in Chandini Chowk, was killed in the Red Fort blast. His family identified the body with his distinctive tattoos dedicated to his parents and wife.

Bihar Phase 2 sees 48% turnout till 1 pm, focus on 'decider' Seemanchal region Live UpdatesBihar elections Phase 2: Several crucial seats from the regions of Magadh, Champaran and Seemanchal, widely known as a decider for every state election, are seeing voting today.

Naseeruddin Shah does a U-turn on Farhan Akhtar remark, says it was exaggeratedNaseeruddin Shah clarified his old remarks about Farhan Akhtar's performance in 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', saying his words were exaggerated by the media. The actor responded after Farhan called his past comments "distasteful."

One body found hanging from tree: The enormity of Red Fort car blastThe blast was so powerful it hurled the victim off the ground, shattered streetlights, and set vehicles ablaze in one of the most crowded stretches near the iconic monument.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Hindu group takes CJI's lord Vishnu remarks to Times SquareMembers of the Hindu diaspora in the US gathered at Times Square in New York City to voice opposition to Chief Justice of India BR Gavai's remark regarding the restoration of a seven-foot Lord Vishnu idol at Khajuraho's Javari temple. Organised by Stop Hindu Genocide, the campaign urged respect for religious sentiments.

India-born Siddhant Awasthi exits Tesla, rose from intern to Cybertruck chiefSiddhant Awasthi's leadership coincided with significant milestones and challenges for the Cybertruck. Between November 2023 and early 2024, 46,096 Cybertrucks were produced, according to US recall filings. The Cybertruck also faced product recalls and sales difficulties, with Tesla offering discounts on inventory vehicles.

Video: Mass panic as people run for cover after blast rocks Red Fort areaA CCTV video captures panicked citizens fleeing as a powerful explosion rocks a busy lane near Delhi's Red Fort, marking the third footage showing the moment of chaos.

No job for my friends: Nikki Haley's son differs with her on H-1B, immigrationNalin Haley, son of former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley, called for ending H-1B visas and halting legal immigration, blaming foreign workers for youth unemployment in the US. The 24-year-old also called for British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan to be thrown out of the country. Nalin said people who hate America should leave the country.

3 hours, one car, and a blast: The Red Fort puzzle cops are trying to solveInvestigators are focusing on the three-hour window when Dr Umar Mohammad's explosives-laden car was parked near the Red Fort before the deadly blast. The period between 3:19 pm and 6:22 pm is now key to uncovering whether the attack was part of a larger network or an isolated act.

2025 Hyundai Venue review: Time for the Brezza, Sonet and Nexon to be afraid?Hyundai has refreshed the Venue with a new design, upgraded interiors, added tech features and improved safety, ready to take on strong rivals in the sub-4 metre SUV segment. On paper, the Venue seems a promising option, but how is it to drive, let's find out.

They'll love us again: Trump says tariffs on India to be reduced in fair trade dealThe US President said that discussions with India have made significant progress and both sides are edging closer to a balanced agreement. He also said the US would eventually bring down tariffs on India.
The 45-minute rule: How the world's most productive people workWhy working in 45-minute focus blocks can make you more productive and less stressed

The woman who made India's first anti-epilepsy drug and changed the face of chemistryAsima Chatterjee became India's first woman to earn a D.Sc. in chemistry, pioneering plant-based medicines. Her work bridged traditional Ayurveda and modern science, overcoming gender bias and inspiring future generations.

Bengal tea seller buys dream scooter for daughter with coins he saved over 4 yearsThe tea shop owner arrived at a scooter showroom with a drum full of small coins he had saved for four years for his daughter's dream ride.

Nithari killings accused to walk free as Supreme Court acquits him in last caseNithari killings: This was the 13th case against Nithari killings accused Surendra Koli. He has already been acquitted in 12 previous cases.

GRAP-III pollution curbs imposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality turns severeDelhi-NCR's air quality worsened to the 'severe' category again on Tuesday, triggering curbs on non-essential construction, older vehicles, and in-person classes for younger students.

Elon Musk asks Grok to identify image of Lord Ganesha. See AI chatbot's replyElon Musk shared a post featuring his AI chatbot, Grok, identifying an image of Lord Ganesha. When asked to explain what it saw, the chatbot's detailed response impressed users online.

Anushka Sharma's Chakda Xpress deserves its release: Actor Dibyendu BhattacharyaIn an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in, actor Dibyendu Bhattacharya shared his disappointment over 'Chakda Express' being shelved. On his 50th birthday today, the actor even reflected on his childhood memories of celebrating the special occasion with family.

Why Guillermo del Toro's Frankenstein is the adaptation every classic deservesGuillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' is a masterful adaptation that brings alive the true spirit of Mary Shelley's novel, focusing on the Creature's humanity rather than horror. It beautifully explores themes of loneliness, rejection, and the complex bond between creator and creation.

sports.headline: England will enjoy bouncy Australian pitches, suits our style: Marcus Trescothick Assistant coach Marcus Trescothick said England are confident of thriving on Australia's fast, bouncy pitches in the upcoming Ashes, believing the conditions will suit their aggressive style of play. He also backed Joe Root to shine in the series.

Ian Botham slams England's Ashes build-up: Not the way I would prepare Ian Botham has questioned England's decision to play just one internal match in Australia before the start of the Ashes, warning that the visitors could arrive underprepared for one of cricket's toughest challenges.

Ben Stokes in beast mode: Ben Duckett fires strong warning to Australia for Ashes Left-handed batter Ben Duckett has praised captain Ben Stokes' intense preparation ahead of the Ashes, calling him "crucial" to England's chances of ending their 14-year wait for a Test series win in Australia.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Will Mumbai Indians release Deepak Chahar? As the Mumbai Indians gear up for IPL 2026, they will look to fix several glaring weaknesses in their squad ahead of the mini-auction. Can they bet on Deepak Chahar for another season after a poor show in 2025? Here is a probable list of players the five-time champions might retain on the deadline day.

Australian tabloid calls Joe Root Average Joe: Ashes banter or disrespect? The Australian media has launched sharp verbal attacks on England's Joe Root and Ben Stokes ahead of the Ashes Test series, starting November 21. Australia are favourites to beat England in the much-awaited five-Test series.

Former World No.2 Ons Jabeur announces pregnancy with husband Karim Kamoun Former World No. 2 Ons Jabeur has announced that she is expecting her first child with husband Karim Kamoun and will be taking a break from tennis to focus on her well-being. Daria Kasatkina, Belinda Bencic, Barbora Krejcikova and other tennis stars congratulated Jabeur.

Atiqa Mir continues meteoric rise, secures historic pole, podium in COTFA series At just ten years old, Atiqa Mir made history as the first female driver to secure pole position in the COTFA Mini class, marking a significant milestone for Indian motorsport with Formula 1 support. She converted her pole into a heat victory and finished third in the final, highlighting her consistency and composure under pressure.

Special toss coin featuring Mahatma Gandhi, Nelson Mandela for Kolkata Test India vs South Africa, 1st Test: A special gold coin bearing Gandhi and Mandela will be used for the toss, marking a symbolic start to the Freedom Trophy Test at Eden Gardens on November 14.

Jammu & Kashmir script history, beat Delhi for first time in 65 years Qamran Iqbal stood unbeaten on 133, while incisive spells from Auqib Nabi and Vanshaj Sharma guided Jammu & Kashmir past Delhi, securing their maiden Ranji Trophy victory over the capital side.

Daria Kasatkina, Belinda Bencic, Barbora Krejcikova and other tennis stars congratulated Jabeur.

She converted her pole into a heat victory and finished third in the final, highlighting her consistency and composure under pressure.

South Africa Tests crucial for India's WTC cycle: Mohammed Siraj Mohammed Siraj is excited for the South African challenge and said that the series against the Proteas will be crucial for India's World Test Championship 2025-27 cycle. India will face

Liverpool face uphill task in Premier League title race after City loss: Andy RobertsonLiverpool defender Andy Robertson admitted that his side faces an uphill battle in the Premier League title race after their loss to Manchester City. Liverpool have already lost five matches in the Premier League this season.

Sunil Chhetri leads footballers' plea for ISL restart: Anger turns to desperationIndian footballing fraternity has urged football authorities to expedite the start of the Indian Super League season, saying players are "desperate" to return to action. In a social media statement, he said footballers are united and ready to play immediately.

England's Bazball approach evolving from reckless and entertaining: Ben DuckettEngland's Ben Duckett is saying that the Bazball approach is evolving ahead of the all-important Ashes series. England have adopted an ultra-aggressive approach since Brendon McCullum took over as the coach of the Test team.

Ashes: Australia's Mitchell Starc calls for spicy wickets over five-day TestsAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc has called on curators to prepare lively, bowler-friendly pitches for the upcoming Ashes series, stressing that financial motives to stretch matches to five days should not influence pitch preparation.

IND vs SA: No rank turner requested by India for Eden Gardens opener, says GangulySourav Ganguly confirmed that India has not sought a turning track for the Eden Gardens Test against South Africa, with the pitch expected to be a sporting surface offering balanced assistance to both batters and bowlers.

CSK send birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of imminent trade: More power to youAmid all the trade rumours, CSK decided to send their birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of the imminent move, which will see the Indian wicketkeeper-batter join the Chennai-base franchise.

Cena wins IC title for 1st time, finally becomes grand slam championJohn Cena has won the WWE Intercontinental title for the very first time by defeating Dominik Mysterio on the November 10 episode of RAW. The win helped Cena complete the Grand Slam in WWE and join an elite list of stars.

IND vs SA: No rank turner requested by India for Eden Gardens opener, says GangulySourav Ganguly confirmed that India has not sought a turning track for the Eden Gardens Test against South Africa, with the pitch expected to be a sporting surface offering balanced assistance to both batters and bowlers.

CSK send birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of imminent trade: More power to youAmid all the trade rumours, CSK decided to send their birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of the imminent move, which will see the Indian wicketkeeper-batter join the Chennai-base franchise.

Cena wins IC title for 1st time, finally becomes grand slam championJohn Cena has won the WWE Intercontinental title for the very first time by defeating Dominik Mysterio on the November 10 episode of RAW. The win helped Cena complete the Grand Slam in WWE and join an elite list of stars.

Samrat Rana becomes India's first world champion in 10m air pistolSamrat Rana became India's first world champion in the men's 10m air pistol event, claiming gold at the ISSF World Championships in Cairo. The 20-year-old from Karnal shot 243.7 in a tense final to edge out China's Hu Kai (243.3) and deliver a landmark victory for Indian shooting.

Jurel at No.3? Ganguly bats for in-form batter's inclusion in Kolkata TestFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly has backed the inclusion of Dhruv Jurel in the lineup for the upcoming Kolkata Test against South Africa. Jurel scored twin hundreds in the recent unofficial Test against South Africa A.

Are India ready for their first real test at home against WTC champions?India captain Shubman Gill is gearing up for a challenging Test series against South Africa, the reigning World Test Champions. While India enter the contest on the back of a recent 2-0 series win, several concerns linger for the hosts ahead of the all-important clash.

Dhruv Jurel's rise sets up make-or-break no. 3 challenge for Sai SudharsanIndia vs South Africa, Kolkata Test: With Dhruv Jurel's form peaking and Rishabh Pant set to return, Sai Sudharsan faces a defining Test series against South Africa to retain India's No.3 spot.

Kolkata Police tighten security for India, South Africa teams after Delhi blastThe Kolkata Police have beefed up security arrangements for the Indian and South African teams ahead of the first Test at Eden Gardens, scheduled to begin on 14 November, following a high-intensity blast in Delhi.

Watch: Sandesh Jhingan urges AIFF to find quick solution on ISL fiascoIndia defender Sandesh Jhingan has called on the AIFF to resolve the ongoing ISL crisis, warning that the uncertainty has left players, clubs, and fans in limbo as Indian football faces a worrying standstill.

Gautam Gambhir leads Indian cricket fraternity in mourning Delhi blast victimsIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir led the cricket fraternity in mourning the victims of the Red Fort car blast, expressing grief and prayers for their families. BCCI President Mithun Manhas and former India opener Shikhar Dhawan also poured in condolences.

Security tightened at Arun Jaitley Stadium for Ranji Trophy after Delhi blastA powerful blast near Delhi's Red Fort killed at least 8 people and injured several others. Security has been increased at Arun Jaitley Stadium ahead of the Day 4 of the Ranji Trophy fixture between Delhi and Jammu & Kashmir in the aftermath of the incident.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
